vague_description: Determine the optimal production schedule for different types of paper using limited machine time while maximizing profit.
detailed_description: Forest Paper makes two types of products: graph paper and music paper. Each type of paper requires the use of two machines, a printing machine and a scanning machine. It takes \param{TimePrintingGraph} minutes on the printing machine and \param{TimeScanningGraph} minutes on the scanning machine to make a ream of graph paper. On the other hand, it takes \param{TimePrintingMusic} minutes on the printing machine and \param{TimeScanningMusic} minutes on the scanning machine to make a ream of music paper. Each machine is available for a maximum of \param{MaxTimePrinting} minutes (printing machine) and \param{MaxTimeScanning} minutes (scanning machine) per day. The company sells a package of graph paper at a profit of \param{ProfitGraph} and a package of music paper at a profit of \param{ProfitMusic}. The company can sell all the paper it makes. How many reams of each type should the company produce in a day in order to maximize profit? What is that profit?
target_objective: Maximize the daily profit from the production of graph paper and music paper
target_constraints: Number of reams of graph paper produced is non-negative
Number of reams of music paper produced is non-negative
Total time used on the printing machine for all graph paper is less than or equal to MaxTimePrinting
Total time used on the scanning machine for all graph paper is less than or equal to MaxTimeScanning
target_parameters: Time taken on the printing machine to make a ream of graph paper
Time taken on the scanning machine to make a ream of graph paper
Time taken on the printing machine to make a ream of music paper
Time taken on the scanning machine to make a ream of music paper
Maximum available time per day for the printing machine
Maximum available time per day for the scanning machine
Profit per package of graph paper sold
Profit per package of music paper sold
